publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-ÖyRothkuppelraumduring T III MQR 23

seg.seg: Er soll auch niemals eine böse Tat tun.
Also, he shall never do a bad deed.
Wenn du aber böse Tat tust, (wirst du) die Frucht davon ... (erfahren(?)).
If, however, you do a bad, the fruit of it ... (you will experience(?)).
If you, o great king, act according to my word, you will attain great glory and kingship among both gods and men.
If you, o great king, act according to my word, you will attain great glory and kingship among both gods and men.
... you are going the wrong way. I say to you with a friendly mind: do not forget this.
Kingship and rulership are not permanent: who is lord will become servant and who is servant (in this birth) will
Kingship and rulership are not permanent: who is lord will become servant and who is servant (in this birth) will become lord (later).

a5 Love the true insight! b4 If you, o great king, act according to my word, you will attain great glory and kingship among both gods and men. b5 ... you are going the wrong way. I say to you with a friendly mind: do not forget this. b6 Kingship and rulership are not permanent: who is lord will become servant and who is servant (in this birth) will b7 become lord (later).

a1 Er soll auch niemals eine böse Tat tun. 445

b6 Wer Herr ist, wird Knecht. 110
